Digital Compass

I designed and implemented a baremetal driver on the Arm Cortex M0+ based FRDMKL25z, for an SS1306 OLED display, enabling control over the displayed image, image polarity (positive/negative), mirroring, and orientation. The driver integrates seamlessly with a QMC5883L compass module, rendering compass heading data on the display. A built-in state machine facilitates switching between various display modes, while a frame rate calculation function aids in system testing and diagnostics. This project demonstrates my proficiency in embedded systems development, encompassing low-level driver programming, sensor integration, and state management. For more information click here.

8051 Board Bring Up

Interfaced a 32KB NVRAM (using a 373 latch for multiplexing) with 8051 and a bit-banged an I2C interface achieving 100kHz communication with EEPROM and IO expanders on an AT89C51. Further streamlined development by establishing a toolchain utilizing make, SDCC, and batchisp.
